critique: The document expresses concern and determination in response to a serious situation in Libya. It conveys a sense of urgency and resolve to protect national security and foreign policy interests. It uses strong language to describe the actions of Qadhafi and his government, highlighting the severity of the situation and the need for immediate action. There is an element of disgust and anger towards the actions described, as well as fear regarding the potential consequences if no action is taken. There is no element of joy or surprise.
